contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox train |name = Odakyu 30000 series EXE |image = OER Romancecar Hakone -EXE-.jpg |imagesize = 300px |caption = Odakyu 30000 series EXE on "Hakone" service, 16 May 2007 |service = 1996–Present |manufacturer = [[Nippon Sharyo]] |family = |numberbuilt = 70 vehicles (7 4+6-car sets) |refurbishment = |formation = 6+4 car sets |operator = [[Odakyu Electric Railway]] |depots = |lines = |carbody = |carlength = {{convert|20|m|ftin|0|abbr=on}} |width = |height = |maxspeed = |weight = |capacity = |acceleration = |deceleration = |traction = VVVF |poweroutput = |electricsystem = 1,500 V DC |collectionmethod = [[Overhead lines]] |brakes = [[Regenerative brake]] |safety = [[Automatic Train Stop|ATS]] (OM) |gauge = {{RailGauge|1067}} }} The {{Nihongo|'''Odakyu 30000 series EXE'''|小田急30000形|Odakyū 30000-gata}} (Excellent Express) is an [[electric multiple unit]] operated by the [[Odakyu Electric Railway]], in Japan. ==Design== The 30000 series EXE has a mostly boxy shape. The nose of the front car is usually slanted, however it could also be flat. On the slant-nosed power car, the headlights are above the cab's front windshield. Below the front window is an [[LED]] display showing the train service name. Below that there is a broad red stripe going vertically down the front, with small black "EXE" letters in the middle of it. On the sides of the cars, there is another vertical red stripe going down the middle of the cars. ==Operations== The 30000 EXE operates mainly between [[Shinjuku Station]] (Tokyo) and [[Hakone-Yumoto Station]] (about 88 km), and also on [[Odakyū Enoshima Line]] ''[[Enoshima (train)|Enoshima]]'' services from Shinjuku to [[Katase-Enoshima Station]]. ==Interior== <gallery> File:OER-EXE30000-inside.jpg|Interior File:OER-EXE30000-inside-Seat.jpg|Seats File:Cockpit of Odakyu RomanceCar EXE 2.JPG|Driver's Cab </gallery> ==References== {{refbegin}} * "Daiya Jōhō" Magazine, May 2007 issue {{refend}} {{reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category|Odakyū 30000 series EXE|Odakyu 30000 series EXE}} * [http://www.odakyu.jp/romancecar/line_up/30000.html "Odakyu Romancecar Lineup"] {{ja icon}} {{Odakyu trainsets}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2010}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Odakyu 30000 series EXE}} [[Category:Electric multiple units of Japan]] [[Category:Odakyu Electric Railway|30000 series EXE]] [[Category:Nippon Sharyo rolling stock]] [[Category:Kawasaki multiple units]] [[Category:1996 introductions]]
